is a fantastically diverse tapestry of vehicles from every breed and era. Delving into the classifieds reveals some real gems waiting to find a new home with both enthusiasts and serious collectors alike. This week, weâ€™re highlighting the top cars we think your dad would love for Father's Day.

Today, the Ford Mustang is one of the most tunable cars for enthusiasts, and that all started with the Shelby GT350. Introduced shortly after the Mustang's debut in 1964, Carroll Shelby squeezed as much performance and handling out of this car to develop the GT350. The

2015 Camaro Takes Duty As Modern Trans Am SE Bandit Edition

Licensing the name and logo from GM, Trans Am Depot picked up where GM left off. The company, along with the help of the Bandit himself, took 77 2015 Chevrolet Camaros and turned them into modern editions of the 77 Trans Am featured in the Movie - T-Tops and all.
For custom car builders, shows like
are the biggest ways to get noticed, and the listing for this
says that this fully custom 'Vette has been on display at all three. With such prominent car shows under its belt, this jaw-dropping C1
is now looking for a new home.

Lead The Pack In This 1994 Ford Mustang Cobra Indy 500 Pace Car

The 1994 model year was a big one for the Ford Mustang as it not only celebrated the 30th anniversary of Ford's pony car and ushered in fourth-gen Mustang, but it was also the third (and most recent) time that a Mustang had the prestigious opportunity to act as pace car for the Indianapolis 500. To celebrate this, Ford built 1,000 examples of the
1994 Ford Mustang SVT Cobra Indy 500 pace car replica
, and this one survives in excellent condition with extremely
